item.title: Fly tipping furniture, 20th November
item.description:
Someone is leaving furniture out on the street and outside peoples houses during the night. The drawers were left out, originally blocking the pavement, two weeks ago and the sofa cushions appeared over the weekend.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westcott Road, Elephant and Castle, Greater London

item.title: Usual flytipping at Durfey Place, 20th November
item.description:
This is a daily occurrence. The Council has a statutory duty to protect health and safety of residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durfey Place, Camberwell, London

item.title: Access constantly blocked, 20th November
item.description:
Churchill way, rear of Robert dyas. We are sick and tired of our access getting blocked despite double yellow lines! I constantly report them, unsure if fines are sent? Tonight’s one meant I could get my car out of our parking spaces. Is there anything that can be done? I did ask for access keep clear painting lines and I know others along here are having the same issues. The works & Cassino have their fire exits blocked on a regular basis!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchill Way, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Man climbed a post and damaged, 20th November
item.description:
Today at 7:34pm I saw a man climbing a lamp post next to London Fields park, across the road from 170B Lansdowne Dr. He did something and pointed the CCTV camera attached to it upwards, so I assume whatever the camera was pointing at is at risk now.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lansdowne Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak from mains stop cock box, 20th November
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Trash in pond, 20th November
item.description:
Trash in pond has been present for months, needs removing. Lots of plastic bottles and other rubbish. Ducks are swimming with it To locate: Enter Danson park from Radnor Avenue entrance. Continue forward/straight on the path until bridge reached. Algea pond on the left while standing on centre of the bridge, lots of rubbish in it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Lane, Welling, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet
